title: Specialist Interview
Interview Descriptions: It was a phone interview followed by committee interview on site. I was asked to prepare a project for review during my on site interview. In addition to the committee, I also met with the department I would be working with and the one-on-one with my supervisor.
Interview Questions: In what ways have you contributed to the success of your unit in your current job?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Stevenson University (Baltimore, MD) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Grueling and cumbersome process; can be conducted in daylong format. Concerns regarding institutional desire for ethnically diverse representation among staff/faculty, as a predominately white (staff/faculty & student populations) institution, particularly in leadership roles.
Interview Questions: Standard questions regarding the role and leadership behaviors, but they were repetitive and excessive.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stevenson University
Interview Descriptions: The application was completed online. The hiring manager confirmed receipt of application via email within ~3 business days. The interview was conducted via phone. Offer sent via email, less than one week from interview.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about a time that you challenged yourself?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stevenson University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I have interview yet. But I heard that the interview process is pretty easy and straightforward. I’m looking forward to my interview this week and I hope it will go well. And I hope I will get accepted too.
Interview Questions: Why are interested in this job?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Interview Descriptions: Great! It was fairly easy, and the interviewers were very nice and intentional about their questions and responses. Be prepared to share your experience with students and how you would use your talents and skills to help
Interview Questions:
Describe a time where? 
How do you plan on executing your ideas with your co-RA

title: Manager Interview
Interview Descriptions: The interview can be very long and tedious but it is very beneficial that you beat prepare for this interview so you have a great chance to be a good candidate
Interview Questions: What your goals for the future

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Interview Descriptions: great detailed questions, on time, great scheduled , they asked about your exp and interested in higher education. Multiple panel interviews, with team and supervisor. Got to know the office very well, followed up by the end the week
Interview Questions: what is your experience in higher ed? working with students

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevenson University (Owings Mills, MD) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at SU was truly an easy process (for someone with Admissions Experience). The first interview (conducted via Zoom) asked approximately 20 questions by the members of the panel (Hiring Manager and two Admissions Counselors). The Second Interview (via Zoom) was taken in three parts; 1st - Search Committee Interview (Hiring Manager and various admissions representatives), 2nd - Presentation Skills Assessment, and 3rd - Individual Interview with the Vice President of Enrollment. Two weeks later, I received an offer.
Interview Questions: How confident are you using recruitment CRM systems? Please explain your proficiency.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevenson University
Interview Descriptions: Not that difficult, the standard questions you are faced with and only one round interview before I was picked. There were two people interviewing me and they were easy to get along with and very professional.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult thing you had to deal with in a work environment

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Stevenson University in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: They seemed unprepared for the interview as the questions asked didn't pertain to the position at all. This is also because the interviewer had only had their position for less than 30 days. I have a feeling that they had already had someone internally that they'd like to go with but interviewed external candidates as a formality. They also had several positions open in the same department, so this was a red flag for me.
Interview Questions: I was nothing about my programming background but how do I decompress after a work day, how do I respond in crisis situations, etc. I was interviewing for Student Activities. Also, the point person who scheduled interview repeatedly pronounced my name wrong even after having been corrected at least 3x.

title: Assistant Director, Public Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stevenson University (Owings Mills, MD) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview with direct manager, press release writing exercise, interview with two other team members. Interviews were easy. Interviewers talked about themselves the majority of the time which should have been a red flag to me to not accept the job as I wasn't challenged in this position nor did I learn anything.
Interview Questions: Tell us why you're leaving your current job

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stevenson University (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: If they are interested in you, a phone interview with be conducted first. A group interview or two will follow. The final interview for full-time employment will be with university president.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions. Be prepared to tell stories.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stevenson University in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: It began with answering an ad. After chatting via email  several times, I was called in to interview with the Hiring Committee and the VP. All parties involved were kind, inquisitive, interested and welcoming.
Interview Questions: There wasn't anything difficult or unexpected.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stevenson University (Stevenson, MD) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: I asked 2 professors for recommendations and submitted my transcript online. A few days later, I got an e-mail to schedule an interview. There wasn't much of an interview; the hiring manager only asked if I had worked before and my answer was no. She told me about the position and then gave me paperwork to fill out after I accepted the job on the spot.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevenson University (Owings Mills, MD) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: Met with department director and HR. Questions were basic and not highly technical. Entire process was smooth. Great place to intern if you can't find something off campus. Great commute!
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in an internship?
